label: 和光同塵
対訳語: Soften the Light and Identify with the Dust.
本: Sand and Pebbles: The Tales of Mujû Ichien, A Voice for Pluralism in Kamakura Buddhism . State University of New York Press . 1985
説明文: This phrase, which expresses the notion that the buddhas, bodhisattvas (bosatsu, q. v.) and the Gods (kami) who are their local manifestations (cf., honji suijaku) soften the light" of their wisdom and "identify with the dust" of human passions in order to save sentient beings, is borrowed from the Taoist Way and Its Power (Tao Te Ching, Dōtokukyō). [菩薩、神、本地垂迹、道徳経]"
